Annotation.String: A shared set of files.
This resource shall be used to represent a shared set of files.
An instance of a shared set of files with a common directory structure.
This resource shall be used to represent a shared set of files with a common directory structure.
A path to an exported file or directory on the file system where this file share is hosted.
The value of this property shall be a path (relative to the file system root) to the exported file or directory on the file system where this file share is hosted.
An array of file sharing protocols supported by this file share.
This property shall be an array containing entries for the file sharing protocols supported by this file share. Each entry shall specify a file sharing protocol supported by the file system.
Indicates the status of the file share.
This value of this property shall indicate the status of the file share.
An array of default access privileges for the file share. The types of default access can include Read, Write, and/or Execute.

The value of this property shall be an array containing entries for the default access privileges for the file share. Each entry shall specify a defaul access privilege. The types of default access can include Read, Write, and/or Execute.
Execute access is supported by the file share.
The value of this property shall indicate whether Execute access is supported by the file share. The default value for this property is false.
Root access is allowed by the file share.
The value of this property shall indicate whether Root access is allowed by the file share. The default value for this property is false.
Defines how writes are replicated to the shared source.
The value of this property shall define how writes are replicated to the shared source.
Continuous Availability is supported. Client/Server mediated recovery from network and server failure with application transparency.

The value of this property shall indicate that Continuous Availability is supported. Client/Server mediated recovery from network and server failure with application transparency. This property shall be NULL unless the FileSharingProtocols property includes SMB. The default value for this property is false.
The maximum number of bytes that may be used by this file share.
If present, the value of this property shall indicate the maximum number of bytes that may be consumed by this file share.
The number of remaining bytes that may be used by this file share.
If present, the value of this property shall indicate the remaining number of bytes that may be consumed by this file share.
An array of low space warning threshold percentages for the file share.

This property shall be an array containing entries for the percentages of file share capacity at which low space warning events are be issued. A LOW_SPACE_THRESHOLD_WARNING event shall be triggered each time the remaining file share capacity value becomes less than one of the values in the array. The following shall be true: Across all CapacitySources entries, percent = (SUM(AllocatedBytes) - SUM(ConsumedBytes))/SUM(AllocatedBytes)
Specifies the type of quota enforcement.

If FileShareQuotaType is present, a value of Soft shall specify that quotas are not enforced, and a value of Hard shall specify that writes shall fail if the space consumed would exceed the value of the FileShareTotalQuotaBytes property.
Contains links to other resources that are related to this resource.
This property shall contain links to other resources that are related to this resource.
A link to the collection of Ethernet interfaces that provide access to this file share.
The value shall be a link to an EthernetInterfaceCollection with members that provide access to the file share.
A link to the ClassOfService for this file share.
This value shall be a link to the ClassOfService for this file share.
A link to the file system containing the file share.
The value shall be a link to the file system containing the file share.
Indicates the types of access allowed by this file share. The types of access allowed can include Read, Write, and/or Execute.
The values shall indicate the types of access allowed by this file share. The types of access allowed can include Read, Write, and/or Execute.
Read access is allowed by the file share.
This value shall indicate that Read access is allowed by the file share.
Write access is allowed by the file share.
This value shall indicate that Write access is allowed by the file share.
Execute access is allowed by the file share.
This value shall indicate that Execute access is allowed by the file share.
Indicates whether quotas are enabled and enforced by this file share. A value of Soft means that quotas are enabled but not enforced, and a value of Hard means that quotas are enabled and enforced.

The value shall indicate whether quotas are enabled and enforced by this file share. If QuotaType is present, a value of Soft shall mean that quotas are enabled but not enforced, and a value of Hard shall mean that quotas are enabled and enforced.
Quotas are enabled but not enforced.
This value shall indicate that quotas are enabled but not enforced.
Quotas are enabled and enforced.
This value shall indicate that quotas are enabled and enforced.
